alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 6:38PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow winds will impact portions of Johnson County through 715 PM MDT... At 636 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflow winds along a line extending from 19 miles east of Lake De Smet to 7 miles west of Saddlestring. Movement was south at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph with gusts between 55 and 60 mph possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated and track by weather instruments. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Kaycee, Mayoworth, Powder River Rest Area, Fort Reno Historical Site, Fort Phil Kearny Historical Site, Saddlestring, Powder River Pass, Dullknife Reservoir, Lake De Smet, Sussex, South Fork Campground, Lost Cabin Campground, Johnson County Fairgrounds and Buffalo Johnson County Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between mile markers 251 and 299. Interstate 90 between mile markers 42 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
